results.title: Die Deutschen luftwaffe. No. 6. Bombers & bomber ops 1942-1945
results.creator_credit: Mike Croker, Mickey Shephard and VAF Productions
results.brief_description: This documentary video contains some rare archival footage of the German Luftwaffe carrying out some of their bombing operations during the years 1942-1945 of World War II including photo-intelligence surveillance, aerial bombings, strikes on allied convoys with anti-ship missiles and night bomber raids against the British. At one stage during 1942, the Luftwaffe were capable of launching up to 1000 sorties per day. However by 1944 due to the growing effectiveness of Allied air power, the Luftwaffe bombing force began to decline, until Germany’s eventual surrender in May 1945. Aeroplane enthusiasts, and particularly those into war planes, will enjoy this documentary for its informative and historical visuals and its coverage of the various bombers used by the Luftwaffe, including the Junkers Ju-88 and Ju-188, the Dornier 217 series and the Heinkel He-111 and He-177, as well as flying boats and float planes operating from the Mediterranean through to the Arctic Ocean (in rare colour footage). Narrated by Brian Matthews.

results.title: Die Abenteuer des Prinzen Achmed (The Adventures of Prince Achmed)
results.brief_description: While many people believe Walt Disney’s Snow White and The Seven Dwarfs (1937) was the first animated feature, Lotte Reiniger’s The Adventures of Prince Achmed precedes the Disney film by over a decade.

constellations_primary.name: Shadowplay and spookiness
constellations_primary.description: Silhouettes and shadows scare up some of the most sinister creatures in cinema and videogames.

constellations_other.name: Cautionary tales and magic lantern projectors
constellations_other.description: Early magic lantern projections depicted cautionary religious scenes and fairytales, just like cinema did in its infancy.

constellations_other.name: Storytelling through shadow play
constellations_other.description: Shadow play has brought stories to life for thousands of years and is still used today.

results.title_for_label: Die Abenteuer des Prinzen Achmed (The Adventures of Prince Achmed)
results.description:
You may not have heard of German animator Lotte Reiniger. She turned her home into a DIY animation studio and pioneered animating silhouettes by shooting homemade puppets frame-by-frame against sheets of lead.

Later she used layers of glass to create depth, devising the first multiplane camera, which she used to create the first colour animated feature film, The Adventures of Prince Achmed (1926). While many people believe Walt Disney’s Snow White and The Seven Dwarfs (1937) was the first animated feature, Reiniger’s fairytale precedes the Disney film by over a decade. With more than 60 animated films to her name, Lotte Reiniger is a true hero of animation.
description_for_label:
You may not have heard of German animator Lotte Reiniger. She turned her home into a DIY animation studio and pioneered animating silhouettes by shooting homemade puppets frame-by-frame against sheets of lead.

Later she used layers of glass to create depth, devising the first multiplane camera, which she used to create the first colour animated feature film, The Adventures of Prince Achmed (1926). While many people believe Walt Disney’s Snow White and The Seven Dwarfs (1937) was the first animated feature, Reiniger’s fairytale precedes the Disney film by over a decade. With more than 60 animated films to her name, Lotte Reiniger is a true hero of animation.

results.title: Did you forget I'm five?
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
Begins with a discussion of general interest to the children - the origin and structure of corn on the cob, related activities including the preparation and cooking of corn follow.

results.title: Dick Whittington and his cat
results.creator_credit: Sterling Educational Films and Tad Wilkosh
results.brief_description: Set in the Middle Ages using puppet animation to tell the story of the boy whose affection for a stray cat leads to wealth and fame, showing that kindness and goodness prevail. Narrated by Stanley Jackson. Written by Israel M. Berman.

results.title: Dick Tracy. Vol. 2
results.creator_credit: Republic Pictures Corporation and Alan James
results.brief_description: This movie serial sees for the first time on screen Dick Tracy (Ralph Byrd) and his G-men battling against urban evil. This time it’s the club-footed mastermind know as The Lame One who plots a war on the G-men. Using his stratospheric aircraft he terrorises the city with his high-frequency sound wave weapon. At the same time, The Spider Gang kidnap Tracy’s brother, Gordon. Part two contains episodes eight to thirteen.

results.title: Diastrophism: what moves mountains, what shapes the seas?
results.creator_credit: Richard Lukin, Universal Education and Visual Arts and Richard Slote
results.brief_description: Part of the “Science and the earth” series, this film provides an explanation of what scientists know about diastrophism, the forces which shape the earth’s surface. While earthquakes and volcanoes provide some information, much more is still required. Using animated maps and drawings the effects of earthquakes on the crust, mantle and core are shown. Such theories as whether the earth’s crust is floating on a sea of molten rock, whether the surface is shrinking or expanding in area, the origin of the continents and whether currents within the earth cause folding, are explored.

results.title: Diary of a student revolution
results.creator_credit: Morten Silverstein and National Educational Television
results.brief_description: An analysis of the question whether a University administration’s action in summoning the police force was an appropriate response to peaceful demonstrations on the Connecticut University campas. Trouble began at the University when industrial recruiting of students by Dow Chemical Company resulted in a confrontation between student activists and the University President.
